name: Identification Key for Arboreal Machaerium of Rio de Janeiro, Mata Atlântica
description: An interactive identification key for 15 arboreal species of the genus Machaerium (Fabaceae) found in the Mata Atlântica biome within the state of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. This key focuses on distinctive morphological features of the stems, leaves, and fruits.

entities.name: Machaerium aculeatum Raddi
entities.description: A spiny tree, often found in disturbed areas and forest edges, characterized by numerous leaflets and falcate fruits.

entities.name: Machaerium nyctitans (Vell.) Benth.
entities.description: Known as 'Jacarandá-branco', an unarmed tree with relatively few leaflets, distinctive emarginate leaflet apex, and orbicular fruits.

entities.name: Machaerium villosum Vog.
entities.description: A robust, unarmed tree distinguished by its densely pubescent young branches and leaves, numerous leaflets, and falcate fruits.

entities.name: Machaerium hirtum Vog.
entities.description: An unarmed tree with noticeable pubescence on young parts, medium number of leaflets, and falcate samaras.

entities.name: Machaerium brasiliense Vog.
entities.description: A common unarmed species with few, acuminate leaflets and orbicular fruits, generally glabrous.

entities.name: Machaerium microphyllum (Vell.) Macbr.
entities.description: An unarmed tree characterized by many small leaflets with obtuse to rounded apices, and narrowly elliptic samaras.

entities.name: Machaerium macrophyllum Glaz.
entities.description: Distinguished by its large leaflets, few in number per leaf, with acuminate apices and falcate fruits.

entities.name: Machaerium scleroxylon Tul.
entities.description: Known as 'Caviúna', a commercially important unarmed timber tree with medium leaflets and falcate samaras, typically glabrous.

entities.name: Machaerium uncinatum (Vell.) Benth.
entities.description: A spiny species with medium-sized leaflets and falcate fruits. The specific epithet 'uncinatum' refers to hooked features, often spines.

entities.name: Machaerium pedicellatum Tul.
entities.description: An unarmed tree with medium leaflet count, acuminate apices, and notably lanceolate to narrowly elliptic samaras.

entities.name: Machaerium campylothyrsum Hoehne
entities.description: An unarmed tree with medium leaflets and distinctive orbicular fruits, often found in humid environments.

entities.name: Machaerium lunatum (L.f.) Ducke
entities.description: A spiny species often found in riparian or mangrove-associated habitats, with few leaflets and emarginate apices, producing orbicular fruits.

entities.name: Machaerium punctatum Pers.
entities.description: An unarmed tree with many leaflets and acuminate apices, characterized by falcate samaras and often punctate (dotted) leaves.

entities.name: Machaerium stipitatum Vog.
entities.description: An unarmed tree species with a medium number of acuminate leaflets and falcate samaras, often recognized by its stipitate (stalked) inflorescences.

entities.name: Machaerium opacum Benth.
entities.description: An unarmed tree with few to medium leaflets, characteristically obtuse to rounded apices, and orbicular fruits, often with an opaque appearance to the leaves.
